sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_176
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_NvM_DataUpdate ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/inc/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.h line 532 Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_processPSOverification ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c line 431 Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_processPSOverification ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c line 444 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/test/swut/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c.test line 1206 The Doorlocking BAP Handler shall store permanently the following data: sBAP_TheftProtectionSensorSetup_ActivationState pBAP_bKYKonfPassiveEntry pBAP_bKYKonfAutoExit pBAP_bKYKonfAutoEntry pBAP_bKYKonfRueckmeldung BAP_virtuelles_pedal pBAP_enKYKonfSchwelleAutoFkt pBAP_entriegelungsmodus pBAP_autolock pBAP_komfortoeffnen_fensterheber pBAP_komfortoeffnen_SAD_PSD pBAP_Elektrische_Laderaumabdeckung_Aktiviert pBAP_quittungston pBAP_komfortschliessen_brasilien
In case of change, the Doorlocking BAP handler shall store data in non-volatile memory once per run cycle.
Additional information: Storing data in non-volatile memory must occur more often than only on Kl_15 change (Kl_30 shall be handled as well). BAP Handler must ensure that most up to date data is always available. Doorlocking settings that are personalized (listed in chapter SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_468 'Personalized parameters') are stored by the ATNs separately for each slot as well, but only if there is Personalization 2.0 in the vehicle. Doorlocking BAP Handler functionality is performed regardless of Personalization version, that's why all settings are mentioned in this requirement. This requirement is regarded as fulfilled as long as it is made sure that all the settings are persisted, regardless of how and where. ID: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_176 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

Requirement is satisfied here: BAPHandler_Doorlocking_TaskCyclicEvent ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/inc/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.h line 1146 Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_FunctionList_Init ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c line 634 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/test/swut/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c.test line 2007 IF the Doorlocking LSG is not currently running (Provide_Bap_Doorlocking_State == 0x00) AND the Doorlocking BAP Handler did not send Rte_Write_BAPHandler_Doorlocking_BAP_sBap_Freigabe_Doorlocking := 0x01 yet THEN the Doorlocking BAP Handler shall initialize all BAP properties via InitSendBuffer with values specified below in _173 and _172
Additional information: The Doorlocking BAP Handler acts as a client and use Require-Port when requesting the LSG state. Doorlocking BAP Handler receives a feedback on sent InitSendBuffer BAP_Request. Feedback for initializing all properties must be successful, if feedback is not successful, then InitSendBuffer needs to be repeated until it is. ID: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_1232 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_UpdateAdaptAndCoding ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/inc/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.h line 374 Requirement is satisfied here: bapi_Doorlocking_UpdateAdaptAndCoding ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c line 326 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/c/test/swut/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_Task.c.test line 824 If the Doorlocking BAP Handler recognized that availability of at least one BAP function have changed, the Doorlocking BAP Handler shall disable BAP communication (Rte_Write_BAPHandler_Doorlocking_BAP_sBap_Freigabe_Doorlocking := 0x00) to recalculate FunctionList.
Additional information: Recalculated FunctionList will be initialized again together with all other properties and BAP communication has to be enabled again with the same behavior as on the wake-up. sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_926
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: Doorlocking_BapIndication_FSG_Control ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/Evo/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_callbacks.c line 337 Requirement is satisfied here: setBit ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/Evo/src/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_callbacks.c line 361 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/appl/BAP/BAPHandler_Doorlocking/Evo/test/swut/BAPHandler_Doorlocking_callbacks.c.test line 641 IF the Doorlocking BAP Handler received Doorlocking.FSG_Control.Controlcode.0 == 0x01 (SetGet OpCode) THEN the Doorlocking BAP Handler shall start the TReset min Timer
Additional information: The TReset minTimer is not controlled by an adaption, it is hardcoded to 200 ms and is interpreted as minimal time needed for reset operation.
During this time Doorlocking BAP Handler should focus on Reset to Factory Settings process. Changes via BAP should not happen during this time, there is however possibility of coding change via diagnostic tools. If changed this way coding is not used for the FunctionList, but for the FSG_Setup/FSG_Setup2 property, there is a risk of missing out on that change (as FunctionList is updated cyclically). It is therefore allowed for the Doorlocking BAP Handler to check after the Reset to Factory Settings process whether there has been a change to mentioned earlier codings and send Status message with updated Doorlocking.FSG_Setup property. ID: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_926 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.para:

IF the Doorlocking BAP Handler received Doorlocking.FSG_Control.Controlcode.1...3 == 0x01 (SetGet OpCode) OR the Doorlocking BAP Handler received Doorlocking.FSG_Control.Controlcode.5...7 == 0x01 (SetGet OpCode) THEN the Doorlocking BAP Handler shall respond with Doorlocking.FSG_Control.Controlcode parameter with received bit set to the value 0x00 (Status OpCode)
Additional information: Bits that are reserved cannot be changed to 0x01, not by the ASG and not by the FSG. If SetGet for value 0x01 is received, the response is always value 0x00.
No error message (Error OpCode) should be reported in this case. ID: SWR_ICAS1_L3_BAPH_DoorL_891 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

IF the Doorlocking BAP Handler received trigger to the Factory Reset for Settings OR the Doorlocking BAP Handler recognized a very first start THEN the Doorlocking BAP Handler shall set the Bit2 of the Doorlocking.ComfortOpen.Setup parameter to the value pa_komfortoeffnen AND pc_el_FH_hinten AND NOT pa_komfortoeffnen_nur_fh_fahrertuer.
